results.title: This is Alice Springs
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film, Television and Laboratories and Ted Wilson
results.brief_description: Alice Springs, the outback centre of Australia as seen by tourists. The main street with modern buildings and shops, up-to-date hotels, air mail delivery by chartered plane, new schools, contemporary homes. The beautiful church dedicated to the memory of John Flynn, “Flynn of the Inland”, who founded the Australian Inland Mission and the Flying Doctor Service. The surrounding country, Stanley Chasm, Uluru, and the airport which keeps it in touch with the rest of Australia.

results.title: This is a recorded message [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Moretti and Jean Bedard
results.brief_description: Made up of hundreds of cut-out colour ads projected in fragmented, rapid succession, this animated film without words takes a critical look at the conditioning process that underlies consumerism in our world of materialism. Seductive advertising is seen as the main motivating force in shaping the desires, the needs and, to a large degree, the lives of modern men and women.

results.title: This is a photograph
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Albert Kish
results.brief_description: Snapshot impressions of a European immigrant’s first five years in Canada. Brilliant and evocative use of photographs overlayed with his reactions to his adopted country, to the environment, and Canadian ways to which he must adjust. At first everything seems strange—the red brick houses, the glass skyscrapers, cars everywhere, stores stuffed with consumer goods—but gradually he becomes accustomed to calling the place home. Interesting use of music and sound effects which combine beautifully with the visuals (a sound montage). (Awards: Toronto; Venice.)

results.title: This happy breed
results.creator_credit: Noel Coward, Cineguild Production and David Lean
results.brief_description: This affectionate tribute to the ordinary man is a panoramic story of the life of a London family during the two World Wars. Based on Noel Coward’s successful play (he also wrote the musical score), the film chronicles the Gibbons family from 1919 to 1939, and was released during the Second World War as part of the British film industry’s war effort. Robert Newton and Celia Johnson are Frank and Ethel Gibbons who, with their daughters Queenie (Kay Walsh) and Phyllis (Betty Fleetwood), face the day to day crises of ordinary life to survive as both individuals and as a family. Stanley Holloway and a very young John Mills star in this production along with narrator Laurence Olivier.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Coward, Cineguild Production and David Lean

results.title: This game of golf
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Frank Gardner
results.brief_description: An entertaining film on a favourite British sport, featuring the skills of such famous golfers as Bobby Locke and John Beharrel, and the play of other famous personalities such as Bing Crosby and Bob Hope, and Australia’s Herb Elliott. Gives some clear and sound illustrations of correct stance, grip and approach, and makes the point that golf is a useful “second string” game for all types of sports people.

results.title: This fowl business
results.creator_credit: British Foundation Pictures and Ronald Haines
results.brief_description: Tells of the “highly specialised and scientific business of poultry farming”. Interesting from a historical viewpoint - much more humane methods (free-range) than those of today’s battery farming.

results.title: This England. No. 9 [Elizabeth I and Mary, Queen of Scots, 1567]
results.brief_description: Using paintings, drawings and sketches, this episode tells of the year 1567 when Mary, Queen of Scots, married James Hepburn, 4th Earl of Bothwell, believed to be her former husband’s murderer, inevitably losing the support of her loyal subjects. Mary is imprisoned and forced to abdicate the throne. Years later Mary attempted to regain the throne, unsuccessfully, eventually fleeing to England to seek support and protection through Queen Elizabeth I.

results.title: This England. No. 8 [Mary, Queen of Scots, 1566]
results.brief_description: Using paintings, drawings and sketches, this episode tells of Mary, Queen of Scots, and the murder of her adviser, David Rizzio, by her husband, Lord Downley, and the subsequent assassination of Downley byJames Bothwell and others loyal to Mary.
